briefdescription.para: Change game focus number.

parameterdescription.para: number to add to focus number
if equals -1, works globally on all devices, see INPUT_DEVICE_* values in constants.h

briefdescription.para: Reset game focus number (set to 0)

parameterdescription.para: if equals -1, works globally on all devices, see INPUT_DEVICE_* values in constants.h

briefdescription.para: Check if game should have focus.

parameterdescription.para: if equals -1, checks all devices, see INPUT_DEVICE_* values in constants.h

simplesect.para: true if focus number == 0, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get action state.

parameterdescription.para: if true and game is unfocused, returns 0; otherwise returns actual value

simplesect.para: actual action state as float, for regular two state buttons returns 0 or 1, for analog buttons/axes returns value in interval <0, 1> with consideration of defined deadzones

briefdescription.para: Returns true just in frame, when action was invoked (button was pressed)

simplesect.para: if the input is limited (click, hold, doubleclick), 'Press' event is limited as well, and reacts to the limiter only! Otherwise it registeres the first event, usually 'press' (change of value from 0)

parameterdescription.para: if true and game is unfocused, returns 0; otherwise returns actual value

simplesect.para: true if action was invoked in that frame, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns true just in frame, when release action happened (button was released)

parameterdescription.para: if true and game is unfocused, returns 0; otherwise returns actual value

simplesect.para: true if action was released in that frame, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns true just in frame, when hold action invoked (button is hold)

parameterdescription.para: if true and game is unfocused, returns 0; otherwise returns actual value

simplesect.para: true if action was released in that frame, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns true just in frame, when double click action invoked (button double clicked)

parameterdescription.para: if true and game is unfocused, returns 0; otherwise returns actual value

simplesect.para: true if action was released in that frame, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Disable key until end of frame.

parameterdescription.para: id of key, defined in KeyCode GetGame().GetInput().DisableKey(KeyCode.KC_RETURN);

briefdescription.para: Enable mouse and keyboard (on consoles)

simplesect.para: state of support mouse and keyboard (on consoles)
state of support mouse and keyboard. If client playing on server where mouse and keyboard is disabled, then return false. (on consoles)
Console: Last state queried from the platform operating system for the active gamepad. PC: Always true.

briefdescription.para: gets currently selected profile
gets profile by index
gets profile by name
setting active profile

memberdef.argsstring: (GamepadButton thumbButton, out float angle, out float value)
memberdef.name: GetGamepadThumbDirection

briefdescription.para: return true if was deflected button.
clears active gamepad
the on OnGamepadIdentification callback will return the first gamepad where the button was pressed

parameterdescription.para: the button that needs to be pressed for the identification

briefdescription.para: returns true if there is an active gamepad selected.
returns true if 'Gamepad' or 'Mouse and Keyboard' is connected
returns true if 'Gamepad' or if 'Mouse/Keyboard' control is allowed locally and on server, and the respective input devicse are connected. Gamepad takes priority.

parameterdescription.para: lists all devices that SHOULD be available, but aren't. Optional.

briefdescription.para: currently lists only available Gamepad, Mouse, and Keyboard. Extendable as needed.

simplesect.para: Input device, with the last input event ('mouse and keyboard', 'controller' or 'unknown' if none input event was fired from the beginning).
For PlayStation, Enter button in Asia territory is typically Circle button (B button), but in Europe and America it is Cross button (A button).

briefdescription.para: callback that is fired when a new gamepad is connected
callback that is fired when gamepad is disconnected
callback that is fired when identification was requested

detaileddescription.para: callback that is fired when mouse is connected (PS: and assigned to the user) does not fire on PC - mouse/keyboard assumed to always be connected
callback that is fired when mouse is disconnected does not fire on PC - mouse/keyboard assumed to always be connected
callback that is fired when keyboard is connected (PS: and assigned to the user) does not fire on PC - mouse/keyboard assumed to always be connected
callback that is fired when keyboard is disconnected does not fire on PC - mouse/keyboard assumed to always be connected

briefdescription.para: called from code on different input device use
